What should I do if I have previously launched VRSCTEST from a version prior to this release?

If you have previously launched VRSCTEST from a version prior to this release, you should delete the following directories before running this new update:

* On Linux: `~/.komodo/vrsctest`
* On MacOS: `⁨Users⁩/⁨{YourUserName}/⁨Library⁩/⁨Application Support⁩/⁨Komodo/vrsctest`
* On Windows: `"%APPDATA%"\Komodo\VRSCTEST`

What kind of software is Verus Desktop, and what kind of risks are involved with using it?

This is experimental and unfinished software, which means that it has not been thoroughly tested and may have bugs or security vulnerabilities. As such, use of this software is at your own risk, and no warranty is provided for any kind of damage that may occur. Additionally, the software is provided "AS IS", without any express or implied warranties, including but not limited to warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, and non-infringement.

Why might my antivirus software flag the software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP"?

The software may be flagged as "not-a-virus" or "PUP" (potentially unwanted program) by antivirus software such as Avast and Kaspersky because it is mining software, which can be installed by third parties to exploit your PC. This is a false positive, and you can learn more about it by reviewing the resources provided: https://blog.malwarebytes.com/detections/pup-optional-bitcoinminer/ and https://www.kaspersky.com/blog/not-a-virus/18015/.
